messages.title: Dear Resident
messages.content: Will Scobie's personal message about growing up and living in South Thanet, and his commitment to the community.

keyPolicies.policyDescription: Commitment to ensuring residents can see a GP within 48 hours.
Will aims to tackle issues with street cleaning, litter, dog mess and is determined to improve recycling rates.
Will is focused on halting UKIP's negativity and fighting for improvements in South Thanet rather than generating headlines.

mentions.tacticalSituation: Positioning as the local pick against national-level politics, aiming to address local concerns over headline generation.

housing.content: Tackling local housing issues related to improving the local area.

leaflet.personalStatement: Will Scobie's personal connection to South Thanet and his hopes to represent it.

politicalExperience.achievements: Working on job creation, supporting local businesses, arranging large investments such as the new Royal Harbour Academy and working to bring a new GP surgery to the area.

quotes.text: I'm delighted that a local lad is standing for Labour.

images.caption: Will Scobie with local constituents and scenes from South Thanet.
